title.english: The Girl Who Leapt Through Space

description:
The story is set in the year 311 of the Orbital Calendar, when humanity has migrated to countless colony clusters in space. A space colony girl named Akiha Shishidou encounters a malevolent artificial intelligence named Leopard that has been installed on a colony.

Akiha is joined by an Inter-Colony Police officer named Itsuki Kannagi, a taciturn young girl named Honoka Kawai, and a robot named Imoko "Imo-chan" Shishidou.

(Source: AniDB)

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
__Height:__ 160 cm

On August 8, 2013, she reported her marriage on her blog

__Non-anime roles:__
- Yelan - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Elie MacDowell - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
- Aglaea - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Astra Yao - Zenless Zone Zero (VG)

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuiyui_makino) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/yui-makino/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_makino0119/) | [Website](http://www.yuiyuimakino.com/)

A Japanese voice actor, singer, and pianist. She married the singer-songwriter [Yutaro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/182317/Yuutarou-Miura) on June 12, 2020. 
 
Makino took up piano at the age of four. Her talent was discovered by the film director Shunji Iwai when she was only seven years old, and from the age of 8 to 17, she played piano solos for three of his films, one of which was _Love Letter_. She then graduated from Tokyo College of Music as piano major in 2008 with the top score in her senior year piano ensemble.

Makino has appeared in two films, several commercials, and a TV Drama. She also sang the ending theme of a Wii game, Arc Rise Fantasia. The song, which she wrote the lyrics and music of herself, was titled "Tenshi no Hashigo ~crepuscular rays~".

She was nominated for "Best Young Seiyuu"  for her outstanding portrayal of Misaki Nakahara in Welcome To The N.H.K!.

**Non-Anime Roles**
- Zhezhi - Wuthering Waves (VG)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile (I'm Enterprise)](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=79) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/manya02)

MAKO is a member of the singing group Bon-Bon Blanco.

[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

[Website](https://aliproject.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/alipro_yukyokai) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/allica_ism/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/AliProjectYukyokai) Introduction Ali Project (typeset as ALI PROJECT) is a Japanese band with a strong Japanese Aristocrat-style image, consisting of Arika Takarano and Mikiya Katakura. Biography In the band's earlier days, their musical style tended towards light, cheerful and/or refreshing songs. However, the sound has changed in recent times to take on a darker and more mysterious tone. Takarano Arika, lead singer/lyricist, has termed this change as a transition from White Alice (白アリ) to Black Alice (黒アリ). Though there has been a general shift towards performing songs in the "Black Alice" phase, Ali Project has occasionally sung in the White Alice style as well. In 1988 they made their indie debut in the chartsas Ari (Ant) Project (蟻プロジェクト) with their album Fantastic Garden (幻想庭園 Gensou Teien). The album was later included in Tatsumi Takayuki's book Philosophy of Progressive Rock (プログレッシヴ・ロックの哲学), which led to the band being classified under the progressive rock genre. Four years later in 1992 they changed their name and made their major debut with their single "Fall in love, maiden" (恋せよ乙女 Koi-seyo otome). Most of their records are released by Toshiba-EMI, Victor Entertainment and Tokuma Japan. The band is notable in the anime community for having their songs featured in several anime opening and ending sequences, most notably the series Noir and Rozen Maiden. Members - [Arika Takarano](https://anilist.co/staff/101307/Arika-Takarano) (宝野アリカ) - vocals, lyrics - [Mikiya Katakura](https://anilist.co/staff/101309/Mikiya-Katakura) (片倉三起也) - music, arrangement (Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kadutaka_nue)

Kazutaka Miyatake is a visual artist and anime designer known for the mechanical design of the Macross TV series and a number of its continuations from Studio Nue, of which he is a founding member. He has also contributed to the mecha design of other series such as Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny.

Kazutaka Miyatake has designed the spaceships of several famous anime series. His attention to detail and mechanical realism have made his designs still admired upon and used in anime series and related products after several years of their initial appearance.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/589238508)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/), currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).
Ceui is a Japanese singer–songwriter originally from Chiba, Japan, though she grew up in Fukuoka. Ceui's name is derived from the Portuguese word for sky, céu.

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oitan125) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/花田十輝)

Jukki Hanada is a Japanese screenwriter and novelist. He is the grandson of literary critic and essayist Kiyoteru Hanada. He formerly belonged to [Takao Koyama's](https://anilist.co/staff/117575/Takao-Koyama) Brother Noppo anime scenario house. He's currently affiliated with SATZ.

He's a big fan of professional baseball and supports the Hiroshima Toyo Carp.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/239115195)

[Website](http://www.studio-ik.com/)

Married to [Kyouhei Ishiguro](https://anilist.co/staff/118624).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
